card.name: Afflicted Deserter
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Afflicted Deserter.

card.name: Alpha Brawl
card.ability: Target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to each other creature that player controls, then each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to that creature.
card.flavor: Being an alpha means proving it every full moon.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The two parts of Alpha Brawl's effect happen sequentially: first the targeted creature deals damage, then the other creatures deal damage. State-based actions aren't checked in the middle, so creatures that are dealt lethal damage by the targeted creature will still deal damage.
1/22/2011 : None of the damage dealt due to Alpha Brawl is combat damage.
1/22/2011 : Combat abilities like first strike, double strike, and trample don't apply and will have no impact on Alpha Brawl's effect.
1/22/2011 : Abilities like lifelink and deathtouch that care about any kind of damage are taken into account.
1/22/2011 : If the targeted creature has infect or wither, the damage it deals will result in -1/-1 counters being put on each creature it deals damage to. The power of those creatures will be reduced when they deal damage back to the targeted creature.
1/22/2011 : The damage dealt by the targeted creature is not divided in any way. For example, if a 3/3 creature is targeted, it will deal 3 damage to each other creature controlled by its controller.

card.name: Altar of the Lost
card.ability:
Altar of the Lost enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast spells with flashback from a graveyard.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Altar of the Lost doesn't allow you to cast spells from any other player's graveyard, although you can spend the mana it produces on such spells if something else allows you to.
1/22/2011 : You can spend mana produced by Altar of the Lost to cast any spell with flashback that you cast from a graveyard. You don't have to be using flashback to cast that spell, however, as long as something else is allowing you to cast that spell.

card.name: Archangel's Light
card.ability: You gain 2 life for each card in your graveyard, then shuffle your graveyard into your library.
card.flavor:
"This is the light of Avacyn. Even in her absence she offers us hope."
—Radulf, priest of Avacyn
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Archangel's Light isn't put into the graveyard until after its instructions are followed. You won't gain 2 life for it, and it won't be shuffled into your library.
1/22/2011 : If you have no cards in your graveyard, you won't gain any life, but you'll still shuffle your library.

card.name: Archdemon of Greed
card.ability:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a Human. If you can't, tap Archdemon of Greed and it deals 9 damage to you.

card.name: Artful Dodge
card.ability:
Target creature is unblockable this turn.
Flashback {U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Those who know the alleys and sewers of the Erdwal can disappear like smoke.

card.name: Avacyn's Collar
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has vigilance.
Whenever equipped creature dies, if it was a Human, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
Equip {2}
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : The triggered ability checks whether the equipped creature as it last existed on the battlefield was a Human. (It doesn't matter what its creature types are in the graveyard.)

card.name: Bar the Door
card.ability: Creatures you control get +0/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"It may not look like much, but it's a good old door with strong wards. It'll hold."
—Olgard of the Skiltfolk

card.name: Beguiler of Wills
card.ability: {T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of creatures you control.
card.flavor: "Come, let me free you of the tyranny of thought."
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : In order to activate the ability, you must be able to target a creature with power less than or equal to the number of creatures you control. The comparison is made again when the ability resolves. If the power is greater than the number of creatures you control at that time, the target is illegal and the ability is countered.
1/22/2011 : The control-changing effect lasts indefinitely, even if the power of the creature becomes greater than the number of creatures you control after the ability resolves.

card.name: Black Cat
card.ability: When Black Cat dies, target opponent discards a card at random.
card.flavor: Its last life is spent tormenting your dreams.

card.name: Blood Feud
card.ability: Target creature fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
card.flavor: Succession is a matter of blood, and by blood it is often decided.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Blood Feud can target two creatures with the same controller.

card.name: Bone to Ash
card.ability:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I can think of worse ways to go. On second thought, maybe not."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : If the creature spell is an illegal target (because it's left the stack, for example) when Bone to Ash tries to resolve, Bone to Ash will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card.
1/22/2011 : A creature spell that can't be countered by spells and abilities is a legal target for Bone to Ash. The creature spell won't be countered when Bone to Ash resolves, but you'll still draw a card.

card.name: Break of Day
card.ability:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, those creatures also are indestructible this turn. (Lethal damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Because Break of Day refers to "those creatures," it affects only creatures you control when it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn. (Normally, an effect that made creatures you control indestructible would affect creatures that came under your control later in the turn.)
1/22/2011 : Break of Day checks your life total only at the time it resolves. Any creatures that became indestructible will continue to be indestructible that turn even if you gain life.

card.name: Briarpack Alpha
card.ability:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Briarpack Alpha enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The wolves turned on us and a chill swept over me. The pack had a new leader."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

card.name: Burden of Guilt
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{1}: Tap enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"Grab an axe and defend the gate! Your despair is an extravagance we can ill afford."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Only Burden of Guilt's controller can activate its ability.

card.name: Burning Oil
card.ability:
Burning Oil deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
Flashback {3}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Every now and then, a devil's prank can give you a good idea.

card.name: Call to the Kindred
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top five cards of your library. If you do, you may put a creature card that shares a creature type with enchanted creature from among them onto the battlefield, then you put the rest of those cards on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : The creature need only share one creature type with enchanted creature, not necessarily all of them. For example, if the enchanted creature was a Human Soldier, you could put a Human Wizard creature card, a Goblin Soldier creature card, or a Human Soldier Ally creature card onto the battlefield.

card.name: Chalice of Death
card.ability: {T}: Target player loses 5 life.

card.name: Chalice of Life
card.ability: {T}: You gain 1 life. Then if you have at least 10 life more than your starting life total, transform Chalice of Life.

card.name: Chant of the Skifsang
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -13/-0.
card.flavor: The skifsang, seafarers of Nephalia, craft spells like other sailors craft nets—making them strong enough to snare even the deadliest catch.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : A creature with power 0 or less assigns no combat damage. (It doesn't assign a negative amount of combat damage.)

card.name: Chill of Foreboding
card.ability:
Each player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Flashback {7}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: "Wait . . . did you fellows hear something?"

card.name: Chosen of Markov
card.ability: {T}, Tap an untapped Vampire you control: Transform Chosen of Markov.

card.name: Clinging Mists
card.ability:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, tap all attacking creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : In most cases, attacking creatures will already be tapped. They still won't untap during their controller's next untap step.
1/22/2011 : Clinging Mists doesn't track the controller of the attacking creatures. If one of them changes controller before its previous controller's next untap step, it won't untap during its new controller's next untap step.

card.name: Counterlash
card.ability: Counter target spell. You may cast a nonland card in your hand that shares a card type with that spell without paying its mana cost.
card.flavor: "Pathetic. Let me show you how it's done."
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : You cast the card in your hand as part of the resolution of Counterlash. Timing restrictions based on the card's type (such as creature or sorcery) are ignored. Other restrictions are not (such as "Cast [this card] only during combat").
1/22/2011 : If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't pay any alternative costs. You can pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has mandatory additional costs, you must pay those.
1/22/2011 : If the card has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value.

card.name: Crushing Vines
card.ability: Choose one — Destroy target creature with flying; or destroy target artifact.
card.flavor:
"Your veil's curse won't stop me, deathmage. I have taken down countless night hunters and this dark plane is not big enough for you to hide."
—Garruk Wildspeaker, to Liliana Vess

card.name: Curse of Bloodletting
card.ability:
Enchant player
If a source would deal damage to enchanted player, it deals double that damage to that player instead.
card.flavor: It is the demon's mark, an infernal claim on the flesh of the guilty.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Curse of Bloodletting works with any damage, not just combat damage. It also doesn't matter who controls the source of the damage that's being dealt.
1/22/2011 : The source of the damage doesn't change. A spell that deals damage will specify the source of the damage, often the spell itself. An ability that deals damage will also specify the source of the damage, although the ability itself will never be that source. Often the source of the ability is also the source of the damage.
1/22/2011 : If more than one Curse of Bloodletting enchants the same player, damage dealt to that player will double for each one (two of them will end up multiplying the damage by four, three of them by eight, and four of them by sixteen).
1/22/2011 : If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt to the enchanted player, that player chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to enchanted player and that player has cast Mending Hands targeting him or herself. The enchanted player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Curse of Bloodletting's effect double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.
1/22/2011 : If the enchanted player controls a planeswalker and noncombat damage is being dealt to the player from a source controlled by an opponent, the enchanted player will choose whether to apply Curse of Bloodletting or the planeswalker redirection effect first. If the player chooses to apply the planeswalker redirection effect first, and the opponent chooses to redirect the damage to the planeswalker, then Curse of Bloodletting won't double the damage.

card.name: Curse of Echoes
card.ability:
Enchant player
Whenever enchanted player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player may copy that spell and may choose new targets for the copy he or she controls.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : When the triggered ability resolves, it creates a copy of that spell for each other player. The active player creates his or her copy and may choose new targets first (if that player isn't the enchanted player), then each other player (except the enchanted player) creates his or her copy and may choose new targets in turn order. The last player who creates his or her copy controls the copy that will resolve first.
1/22/2011 : All the copies are created on the stack, so none of them are cast. Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copies will then resolve as normal, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities.
1/22/2011 : Each copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless its controller chooses new ones. That player may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, that player can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).
1/22/2011 : If the original spell is modal (that is, it says "Choose one --" or the like), each copy will have the same mode(s). You can't choose different ones.
1/22/2011 : If the original spell has an X whose value was determined as it was cast, each copy has the same value of X.
1/22/2011 : You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too. For example, if the enchanted player sacrifices a 3/3 creature to cast Fling, each copy of Fling will also deal 3 damage.

card.name: Curse of Exhaustion
card.ability:
Enchant player
Enchanted player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
card.flavor:
"I do believe your heresy will prove more difficult now that you have more pressing concerns."
—Bishop Argust
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Curse of Exhaustion will look at the entire turn to see if the enchanted player has cast a spell yet that turn, even if Curse of Exhaustion wasn't on the battlefield when that spell was cast.

card.name: Curse of Misfortunes
card.ability:
Enchant player
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a Curse card that doesn't have the same name as a Curse attached to enchanted player, put it onto the battlefield attached to that player, then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : The Curse card you put onto the battlefield must have a different name than each other Curse enchanting the enchanted player when the triggered ability resolves. If multiple of these abilities trigger, the Curse card you put onto the battlefield when the first resolves may impact your choices for each subsequent one.

card.name: Curse of Thirst
card.ability:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of Thirst deals damage to that player equal to the number of Curses attached to him or her.
card.flavor:
"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."
—Odila, witch of Morkrut
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : The number of Curses attached to the player is counted when the ability resolves.

card.name: Dawntreader Elk
card.ability: {G}, Sacrifice Dawntreader Elk: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Silent as winter snow, it seeks wild places unspoiled by the walking dead.

card.name: Deadly Allure
card.ability:
Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn and must be blocked this turn if able.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: What could be more irresistible than death?
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : If the target creature is attacking, the defending player must assign at least one blocker to it during the declare blockers step if that player controls any creatures that could block it.

card.name: Death's Caress
card.ability: Destroy target creature. If that creature was a Human, you gain life equal to its toughness.
card.flavor: The faint smell of cloves, the rustling of the wind, and a paralyzing descent into an airless, fathomless tomb.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Check the creature as it last existed on the battlefield to determine if it was a Human. If it was, use its toughness as it last existed on the battlefield to determine how much life is gained.
1/22/2011 : If the target creature isn't on the battlefield or is otherwise an illegal target when Death's Caress tries to resolve, Death's Caress is countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain any life.
1/22/2011 : If Death's Caress resolves but the target creature isn't destroyed, perhaps because it's indestructible or it regenerated, you still check if it's a Human. If so, you'll gain life equal to its toughness.

card.name: Deranged Outcast
card.ability: {1}{G}, Sacrifice a Human: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.
card.flavor: Cast out by his village, he now takes grim offense at refugees who seek shelter in his forest.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : You can sacrifice any Human you control, including Deranged Outcast itself.
1/22/2011 : Because targets are chosen before costs are paid, you can activate Deranged Outcast's ability targeting itself and then sacrifice Deranged Outcast to pay the cost.

card.name: Diregraf Captain
card.ability:
Deathtouch
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever another Zombie you control dies, target opponent loses 1 life.
card.flavor: Though its mind has long since rotted away, it wields a sword with deadly skill.

card.name: Divination
card.ability: Draw two cards.
card.flavor: Even the House of Galan, who takes the most scholarly approach to the mystic traditions, has resorted to exploring more primitive methods in Avacyn's absence.

card.name: Drogskol Captain
card.ability:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +1/+1 and have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
card.flavor: Dead or alive, true leaders can inspire an entire army.

card.name: Drogskol Reaver
card.ability:
Flying, double strike, lifelink
Whenever you gain life, draw a card.
card.flavor: Wracked and warped with anguish, it obsessively seeks out other souls to hoard within its eternal prison.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : If Drogskol Reaver deals enough first-strike damage to destroy each creature it's blocking or was blocked by, it won't deal any damage during the regular combat damage step (unless it's attacking and somehow gains trample). Its ability won't trigger a second time that combat.
1/22/2011 : The ability triggers just once for each life-gaining event, no matter how much life was gained.
1/22/2011 : If multiple creatures with lifelink you control deal combat damage at the same time, the damage dealt by each of those creatures is a separate life-gaining event and Drogskol Reaver's ability will trigger that many times.
1/22/2011 : If a creature with lifelink you control deals damage to multiple creatures, players, and/or planeswalkers at the same time, the ability will trigger just once. The damage dealt by that creature is a single life-gaining event.

card.name: Dungeon Geists
card.ability:
Flying
When Dungeon Geists enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Dungeon Geists.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : If another player gains control of Dungeon Geists, the creature will no longer be affected by the ability preventing it from untapping, even if you later regain control of Dungeon Geists.
1/22/2011 : If you gain control of the creature that's being prevented from untapping, that creature won't untap during your untap step for as long as you control Dungeon Geists.
4/15/2013 : The ability can target a tapped creature. If the targeted creature is already tapped when it resolves, that creature just remains tapped and doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

card.name: Elbrus, the Binding Blade
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0.
When equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, unattach Elbrus, the Binding Blade, then transform it.
Equip {1}

card.name: Elgaud Inquisitor
card.ability:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
When Elgaud Inquisitor dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: "It will take more than steel alone to purge this world of evil."

card.name: Erdwal Ripper
card.ability:
Haste
Whenever Erdwal Ripper deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: Savage vampires lurk in the Erdwal's network of passageways where prey is plentiful and easy to catch.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The +1/+1 counter isn't put on the creature in time to increase the amount of combat damage dealt during that combat step.
1/22/2011 : If this creature deals combat damage to multiple players simultaneously, perhaps because some combat damage was redirected, its ability will trigger for each of those players.

card.name: Evolving Wilds
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor:
"Our world is vast, but Thraben is its heart. The cathedral must stand even if the hinterlands are lost."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

card.name: Executioner's Hood
card.ability:
Equipped creature has intimidate. (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Faithless Looting
card.ability:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: "Avacyn has abandoned us! We have nothing left except what we can take!"

card.name: Faith's Shield
card.ability:
Target permanent you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, instead you and each permanent you control gain protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Faith's Shield targets a permanent regardless of how much life you have. If that permanent is an illegal target when Faith's Shield tries to resolve, Faith's Shield will be countered and none of its effects will happen. Neither you nor any of your permanents will gain protection from a color.
1/22/2011 : You choose only one color (not one color per player and permanent). You choose the color as Faith's Shield resolves.
1/22/2011 : A player with protection from a color can't be damaged, enchanted (including by Curses), or targeted by anything of that color.

card.name: Falkenrath Aristocrat
card.ability:
Flying, haste
Sacrifice a creature: Falkenrath Aristocrat is indestructible this turn. If the sacrificed creature was a Human, put a +1/+1 counter on Falkenrath Aristocrat.
card.flavor: "Your blood is quite pleasing. A pity there's not enough for both of us."
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The ability checks whether the sacrificed creature as it last existed on the battlefield was a Human. (It doesn't matter what its creature types are in the graveyard.)
1/22/2011 : You can sacrifice Falkenrath Aristocrat itself to activate its ability.

card.name: Falkenrath Torturer
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Falkenrath Torturer gains flying until end of turn. If the sacrificed creature was a Human, put a +1/+1 counter on Falkenrath Torturer.
card.flavor: "There was a time when our cages rang with wailing. Now only a handful of these whimpering fools remain."
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The ability checks whether the sacrificed creature as it last existed on the battlefield was a Human. (It doesn't matter what its creature types are in the graveyard.)
1/22/2011 : You can sacrifice Falkenrath Torturer itself to activate its ability.

card.name: Farbog Boneflinger
card.ability: When Farbog Boneflinger enters the battlefield, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Here are some bones for you to choke on, dear brother!"
—Gisa, to Geralf
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Farbog Boneflinger's ability is mandatory. If it's the only creature on the battlefield, you must choose it as the target and give it -2/-2 until end of turn.

card.name: Favor of the Woods
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: Feeling abandoned by Avacyn, some Kessigers turned to the pagan rituals of their ancestors.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : The ability will trigger only once per combat, even if the enchanted creature somehow blocks multiple attacking creatures.

card.name: Feed the Pack
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, you may sacrifice a nontoken creature. If you do, put X 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : You choose whether to sacrifice a nontoken creature and which creature to sacrifice when Feed the Pack's ability resolves.
1/22/2011 : Check the sacrificed creature's toughness as it last existed on the battlefield to determine how many Wolves you put onto the battlefield.

card.name: Fiend of the Shadows
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Fiend of the Shadows deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles a card from his or her hand. You may play that card for as long as it remains exiled.
Sacrifice a Human: Regenerate Fiend of the Shadows.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Playing a card exiled with Fiend of the Shadows follows all the normal rules for playing that card. You must pay its costs, and you must follow all timing restrictions, for example.
1/22/2011 : You may only play the card, meaning play it as a land or cast it as a spell. It's not in your hand. You can't discard it, activate its cycling abilities, and so on.
1/22/2011 : As long as the card remains exiled, you may still play it, even if Fiend of the Shadows leaves the battlefield or changes controllers.
1/22/2011 : If this creature deals combat damage to multiple players simultaneously, perhaps because some combat damage was redirected, its ability will trigger for each of those players.

card.name: Fires of Undeath
card.ability:
Fires of Undeath deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {5}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: "I drink of those who are worthy of my palate. The rest I burn."

card.name: Flayer of the Hatebound
card.ability:
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever Flayer of the Hatebound or another creature enters the battlefield from your graveyard, that creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Flayer of the Hatebound's last ability will trigger even if a creature enters the battlefield from your graveyard under another player's control.
1/22/2011 : The creature that entered the battlefield from your graveyard deals damage equal to its current power (including any +1/+1 counters it entered the battlefield with) to the target creature or player. If it's no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, its last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.
1/22/2011 : Flayer of the Hatebound is the source of the ability, but it may be another creature that is the source of the damage. If a black creature enters the battlefield from your graveyard, the ability could target a creature with protection from black, although the damage will be prevented. It couldn't target a creature with protection from red.
1/22/2011 : Since damage is dealt by the creature, abilities like lifelink and deathtouch are taken into account, even if the creature has left the battlefield by the time it deals damage.
1/22/2011 : If you cast a creature card from your graveyard, that card will be put on the stack before entering the battlefield. Flayer of the Hatebound won't trigger.

card.name: Fling
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Fling, sacrifice a creature.
Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Masters of the sword know the blade is not the only weapon at their disposal.
card.ruling:
8/15/2010 : The sacrificed creature's last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.
8/15/2010 : If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Forge Devil
card.ability: When Forge Devil enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to you.
card.flavor: Devils infiltrated the lower levels of Thraben Cathedral, making cracks in load-bearing pillars and setting fire to precious archives.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Forge Devil's ability is mandatory. If it's the only creature on the battlefield, you'll have to choose it as the target and have it deal 1 damage to itself and 1 damage to you.

card.name: Gather the Townsfolk
card.ability:
Put two 1/1 white Human creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, put five of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.
card.flavor: In the memories of those they lost lies the strength needed to defend their city.

card.name: Gavony Ironwright
card.ability: Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control get +1/+4.
card.flavor: "I wish my work could shelter everyone, yet I pray we are never so few that it does."

card.name: Geralf's Messenger
card.ability:
Geralf's Messenger enters the battlefield tapped.
When Geralf's Messenger enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Geralf's Mindcrusher
card.ability:
When Geralf's Mindcrusher enters the battlefield, target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Ghastly Haunting
card.ability:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

card.name: Ghoultree
card.ability: Ghoultree costs {1} less to cast for each creature card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: It uproots entire fengrafs to add to its twisted frame.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Ghoultree's ability can't reduce the total cost to cast the spell below {G}.
1/22/2011 : Although players may respond to Ghoultree once it's been cast, once it's announced, they can't respond before the cost is calculated and paid.

card.name: Grafdigger's Cage
card.ability:
Creature cards can't enter the battlefield from graveyards or libraries.
Players can't cast cards in graveyards or libraries.
card.flavor:
"If you wind up in one of mine, you can be sure as silver it will be your last."
—Grafdigger Wulmer
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : If a creature card tries to enter the battlefield from a graveyard or library, it stays in its current zone.
4/15/2013 : The first ability checks only whether the card is a creature card in the graveyard or library. A card such as Sculpting Steel can still enter the battlefield from a graveyard or library as a copy of a creature.
4/15/2013 : The second ability doesn't stop players from playing land cards from graveyards or libraries since lands aren't cast.

card.name: Gravecrawler
card.ability:
Gravecrawler can't block.
You may cast Gravecrawler from your graveyard as long as you control a Zombie.
card.flavor:
"Innistrad's ghoulcallers are talented enough, but let me show you what someone with real power can create."
—Liliana Vess
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Gravecrawler's ability doesn't change when you could cast it.
1/22/2011 : Once you've cast Gravecrawler and it's on the stack, it doesn't matter if you lose control of the other Zombie.

card.name: Gravepurge
card.ability:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"The Blessed Sleep? Ha! Wake up my lovelies, there's work to be done!"
—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : You choose the order of the cards you put on top of your library.
1/22/2011 : You can cast Gravepurge with zero targets. If you do, you'll draw a card as the spell resolves.
1/22/2011 : If you cast Gravepurge with at least one target and all of those targets become illegal, the spell will be countered and you won't get to draw a card.

card.name: Gravetiller Wurm
card.ability:
Trample
Morbid — Gravetiller Wurm enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.
card.flavor: As the creatures of the night closed in on humanity, Innistrad's primeval forces stirred, as though waking to watch the slaughter.

card.name: Grim Backwoods
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{B}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I love what they've done with the place."
—Liliana Vess

card.name: Grim Flowering
card.ability: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."
—Halana of Ulvenwald
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Count the number of creature cards in your graveyard when Grim Flowering resolves.

card.name: Griptide
card.ability: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"Beware the seagrafs just off the shore. These waters are filled with hungry geists looking for an easy meal."
—Captain Eberhart

card.name: Gruesome Discovery
card.ability:
Target player discards two cards.
Morbid — If a creature died this turn, instead that player reveals his or her hand, you choose two cards from it, then that player discards those cards.

card.name: Harrowing Journey
card.ability: Target player draws three cards and loses 3 life.
card.flavor:
"There are always fools who attempt to traverse Kruin Pass before sundown and every time they wind up in a race for their lives."
—Old Rutstein

card.name: Haunted Fengraf
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Haunted Fengraf: Return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: A ghoulcaller's playground.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The creature card returned to your hand is chosen at random as the ability resolves. If any player responds to the ability, that player won't yet know what card will be returned.
1/22/2011 : Because the ability doesn't target any creature card, any creature card put into the graveyard in response to that ability may be returned to your hand.

card.name: Havengul Lich
card.ability: {1}: You may cast target creature card in a graveyard this turn. When you cast that card this turn, Havengul Lich gains all activated abilities of that card until end of turn.
card.flavor: Fusing intelligence with the power of undeath requires inspiration of the darkest kind.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Havengul Lich's activated ability creates a delayed triggered ability that triggers when you cast the creature card. This triggered ability will go on the stack on top of the creature spell and will resolve before the creature spell will.
1/22/2011 : If you don't cast the creature card that turn, Havengul Lich won't gain any of its abilities.
1/22/2011 : Havengul Lich gains the activated abilities of the card while that card is still a spell on the stack.
4/15/2013 : Havengul Lich's ability changes the zone you are permitted to cast the card from, not the times you are permitted to cast it. You can cast a creature card that has been targeted by Havengul Lich from the graveyard, but unless it has flash, you can only do so if it's your main phase, the stack is empty, and you have priority.

card.name: Havengul Runebinder
card.ability: {2}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield, then put a +1/+1 counter on each Zombie creature you control.
card.flavor: "So many corpses, so little time."
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Although players may respond to the activated ability, they can't respond to the paying of its costs. The creature card will already be exiled by the time any player could respond.
1/22/2011 : The Zombie creature token you put onto the battlefield will also get a +1/+1 counter.

card.name: Headless Skaab
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Headless Skaab, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Headless Skaab enters the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor: A head is a needless encumbrance when muscle is all that's required.

card.name: Heavy Mattock
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
As long as equipped creature is a Human, it gets an additional +1/+1.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Heckling Fiends
card.ability: {2}{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.
card.flavor: Their language may be a cacophonous agglomeration of chittering snorts and mad barking, but the message they send is all too clear.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The creature's controller still decides which player or planeswalker the creature attacks.
1/22/2011 : If, during a player's declare attackers step, a creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

card.name: Hellrider
card.ability:
Haste
Whenever a creature you control attacks, Hellrider deals 1 damage to defending player.
card.flavor:
"Behind every devil's mayhem lurks a demon's scheme."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : This damage is not combat damage and may be redirected to a planeswalker controlled by the defending player.
1/22/2011 : If a creature you control attacks a planeswalker, the defending player is the controller of that planeswalker.
1/22/2011 : In some multiplayer variants, creatures you control may attack multiple players and/or planeswalkers. For each attacking creature, Hellrider will deal damage to the corresponding defending player.

card.name: Helvault
card.ability:
{1}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.
{7}, {T}: Exile target creature you don't control.
When Helvault is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return all cards exiled with it to the battlefield under their owners' control.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Helvault's first and third abilities are linked. Similarly, Helvault's second and third abilities are linked. Only cards exiled as a result of Helvault's first or second abilities will be returned to the battlefield by its third ability.

card.name: Highborn Ghoul
card.ability: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
card.flavor:
"All the dead sleep lightly here, no matter how refined their beds may be."
—Grafdigger Wulmer

card.name: Hinterland Hermit
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hinterland Hermit.

card.name: Hinterland Scourge
card.ability:
Hinterland Scourge must be blocked if able.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Hinterland Scourge.

card.name: Hollowhenge Beast
card.flavor: In a world of monsters, it's the stuff of nightmares.

card.name: Hollowhenge Spirit
card.ability:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Hollowhenge Spirit enters the battlefield, remove target attacking or blocking creature from combat.
card.flavor: Some spirits mourn. Others terrorize.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Removing an attacking creature from combat doesn't untap that creature.
1/22/2011 : Removing a blocking creature from combat doesn't cause the creature it was blocking to become unblocked. If no other creatures are blocking that attacking creature, it won't assign combat damage (unless it has trample).
1/22/2011 : If there are multiple combat phases in a turn, a creature that's been removed from combat can still attack or block in future combat steps that turn.

card.name: Hunger of the Howlpack
card.ability:
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Morbid — Put three +1/+1 counters on that creature instead if a creature died this turn.
card.flavor:
"Werewolves are an unholy mix of a predator's instinct and a human's hatred."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

card.name: Huntmaster of the Fells
card.ability:
Whenever this creature enters the battlefield or transforms into Huntmaster of the Fells, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield and you gain 2 life.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Huntmaster of the Fells.

card.name: Immerwolf
card.ability:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Each other creature you control that's a Wolf or a Werewolf gets +1/+1.
Non-Human Werewolves you control can't transform.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : A creature that's both a Wolf and a Werewolf gets the bonus only once.
1/22/2011 : Immerwolf's bonus never applies to itself, even if it somehow becomes a Werewolf creature.
1/22/2011 : A "non-Human Werewolf" is a creature that is a Werewolf but is not a Human.

card.name: Increasing Ambition
card.ability:
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. If Increasing Ambition was cast from a graveyard, instead search your library for two cards and put those cards into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Flashback {7}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Increasing Confusion
card.ability:
Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If Increasing Confusion was cast from a graveyard, that player puts twice that many cards into his or her graveyard instead.
Flashback {X}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Regardless of which zone Increasing Confusion is cast from, it puts cards from the top of target player's library into that player's graveyard.

card.name: Increasing Devotion
card.ability:
Put five 1/1 white Human creature tokens onto the battlefield. If Increasing Devotion was cast from a graveyard, put ten of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.
Flashback {7}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Increasing Savagery
card.ability:
Put five +1/+1 counters on target creature. If Increasing Savagery was cast from a graveyard, put ten +1/+1 counters on that creature instead.
Flashback {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Increasing Vengeance
card.ability:
Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. If Increasing Vengeance was cast from a graveyard, copy that spell twice instead. You may choose new targets for the copies.
Flashback {3}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Increasing Vengeance can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell you control, not just one with targets.
1/22/2011 : When Increasing Vengeance resolves, it creates one or two copies of a spell. You control each of the copies. Those copies are created on the stack, so they're not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copies will then resolve like normal spells, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities.
1/22/2011 : Each of the copies will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal). If there are two copies, you may change the targets of each of them to different legal targets.
1/22/2011 : If the spell Increasing Vengeance copies is modal (that is, it says "Choose one --" or the like), the copies will have the same mode(s). You can't choose different ones.
1/22/2011 : If the spell Increasing Vengeance copies has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X.
1/22/2011 : You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copies. However, effects based on any additional costs that were paid for the original spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copies too. For example, if you sacrifice a 3/3 creature to cast Fling and then copy it with Increasing Vengeance, the copies of Fling will also deal 3 damage to its target.

card.name: Jar of Eyeballs
card.ability:
Whenever a creature you control dies, put two eyeball counters on Jar of Eyeballs.
{3}, {T}, Remove all eyeball counters from Jar of Eyeballs: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of eyeball counters removed this way. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

card.name: Kessig Recluse
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
card.flavor: Its silk is highly prized, but then again, so is your life.

card.name: Krallenhorde Killer
card.ability:
{3}{G}: Krallenhorde Killer gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Krallenhorde Killer.

card.name: Lambholt Elder
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Lambholt Elder.

card.name: Lingering Souls
card.ability:
Put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
Flashback {1}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: The murdered inhabitants of Hollowhenge impart to the living the terror they felt in death.

card.name: Lost in the Woods
card.ability: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Forest card, remove that creature from combat. Then put the revealed card on the bottom of your library.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Removing an attacking creature from combat doesn't untap that creature.
1/22/2011 : Because Lost in the Woods will trigger once for each creature that attacks you or a planeswalker you control, it's important to specify which trigger is associated with which attacking creature before revealing any cards.

card.name: Loyal Cathar
card.ability:
Vigilance
When Loyal Cathar dies, return it to the battlefield transformed under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Markov Blademaster
card.ability:
Double strike
Whenever Markov Blademaster deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: "Mortals practice swordplay for a few decades at best. How can they ever attain the exquisite mastery that eternity has to offer?"
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The +1/+1 counter isn't put on Markov Blademaster in time to increase the amount of combat damage dealt during that combat step. However, the +1/+1 counter put on Markov Blademaster when first-strike damage is dealt will increase the amount of damage dealt during the regular combat damage step.
1/22/2011 : If this creature deals combat damage to multiple players simultaneously, perhaps because some combat damage was redirected, its ability will trigger for each of those players.

card.name: Markov Warlord
card.ability:
Haste
When Markov Warlord enters the battlefield, up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
card.flavor: "What use is a stake or holy symbol in the hands of a coward?"
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : You may target zero, one, or two creatures with Markov Warlord's enters-the-battlefield triggered ability.
1/22/2011 : The creatures can't block any creatures that turn, not just Markov Warlord.

card.name: Midnight Guard
card.ability: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, untap Midnight Guard.
card.flavor:
"When you're on watch, no noise is harmless and no shadow can be ignored."
—Olgard of the Skiltfolk

card.name: Mikaeus, the Unhallowed
card.ability:
Intimidate
Whenever a Human deals damage to you, destroy it.
Other non-Human creatures you control get +1/+1 and have undying. (When a creature with undying dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Noncombat damage dealt to you by a Human and damage dealt to you by a Human you control will also cause Mikaeus's triggered ability to trigger.
1/22/2011 : The +1/+1 bonus that Mikaeus gives to other non-Human creatures is not a counter and won't prevent the undying ability from working.
1/22/2011 : Mikaeus, the Unhallowed and the Innistrad set's Mikaeus, the Lunarch can be on the battlefield at the same time. The "legend rule" applies only to legendary permanents that have exactly the same card name.

card.name: Mondronen Shaman
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mondronen Shaman.

card.name: Moonscarred Werewolf
card.ability:
Vigilance
{T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Moonscarred Werewolf.

card.name: Moonveil Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Each creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Their hearts beat, their lungs draw breath, and they have one true form. I count them as allies of the living."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

card.name: Mystic Retrieval
card.ability:
Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Mystic Retrieval can't target itself. It's on the stack when you choose its target.

card.name: Nearheath Stalker
card.ability: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: "Do not speak of this to the elders. They look unfavorably upon my indulgences."

card.name: Nephalia Seakite
card.ability:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
card.flavor:
"Keep one eye on the cliff road or you may fall to your death. Keep one eye on the sky or your death may fall on you."
—Manfried Ulmach, Elgaud Master-at-Arms

card.name: Niblis of the Breath
card.ability:
Flying
{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
card.flavor:
"Why do the dead remain among us? Where is Flight Alabaster to lead them home? Where is Avacyn?"
—Eruth of Lambholt

card.name: Niblis of the Mist
card.ability:
Flying
When Niblis of the Mist enters the battlefield, you may tap target creature.
card.flavor:
"Not even a roaring fire could thaw the chill it put in my heart."
—Vonn, geist-trapper

card.name: Niblis of the Urn
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Niblis of the Urn attacks, you may tap target creature.
card.flavor:
"I never had the nerve to open that bottle. I'll bet you're wishing right now you hadn't been so curious yourself."
—Old Rutstein

card.name: Predator Ooze
card.ability:
Predator Ooze is indestructible.
Whenever Predator Ooze attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Predator Ooze this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Predator Ooze.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Each time a creature dies, check whether Predator Ooze had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Predator Ooze's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.

card.name: Pyreheart Wolf
card.ability:
Whenever Pyreheart Wolf attacks, each creature you control can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Pyreheart Wolf's first triggered ability also affects creatures that weren't on the battlefield when it resolved but enter the battlefield later that turn. While this normally will have little impact, it could matter if those creatures enter the battlefield attacking or if there are multiple combat phases that turn.

card.name: Ravager of the Fells
card.ability:
Trample
Whenever this creature transforms into Ravager of the Fells, it deals 2 damage to target opponent and 2 damage to up to one target creature that player controls.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ravager of the Fells.

card.name: Ravenous Demon
card.ability: Sacrifice a Human: Transform Ravenous Demon. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

card.name: Ray of Revelation
card.ability:
Destroy target enchantment.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor:
"May angels carry him into the Blessed Sleep with dreams of sunlit days and moonless nights."
—Tomb inscription of Saint Raban

card.name: Reap the Seagraf
card.ability:
Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
Flashback {4}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: The wreck hung on the jagged reef, each night disgorging more of its gruesome cargo.

card.name: Relentless Skaabs
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Relentless Skaabs, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : When Relentless Skaabs returns to the battlefield because of its undying ability, it's not being cast. You won't exile a creature card from your graveyard.

card.name: Requiem Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever another non-Spirit creature you control dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: When angels despair, what hope can remain for mortals?

card.name: Russet Wolves
card.flavor:
"The wolves of our valley are bred to detest the scent of ghouls. For centuries they have kept our estates clear of such carrion."
—Olivia Voldaren

card.name: Sanctuary Cat
card.flavor: Cats prowl the corridors of Avacyn's churches in search of devils or signs of their mischief.

card.name: Saving Grasp
card.ability:
Return target creature you own to your hand.
Flashback {W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Nothing's more valuable than perfect timing.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Saving Grasp can target any creature you own, even one controlled by another player.

card.name: Scorch the Fields
card.ability: Destroy target land. Scorch the Fields deals 1 damage to each Human creature.
card.flavor:
"Your fields will turn as black as a ghoul's tongue and fire shall be your only harvest."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : If the targeted land is an illegal target when Scorch the Fields tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be dealt to any Human.
1/22/2011 : Scorch the Fields doesn't target any Humans. You can cast Scorch the Fields even if there aren't any Humans on the battlefield.

card.name: Scorned Villager
card.ability:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Scorned Villager.

card.name: Screeching Skaab
card.ability: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.

card.name: Séance
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, you may exile target creature card from your graveyard. If you do, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that card except it's a Spirit in addition to its other types. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : The copy doesn't have haste (unless the card it's copying has haste) and usually won't be able to attack.

card.name: Secrets of the Dead
card.ability: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"The veil between the living and the dead is so very thin that the whispers of the ancients can finally be heard."
—Amalric of Midvast Hall
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Secrets of the Dead's triggered ability resolves before the spell you cast from your graveyard does.

card.name: Shattered Perception
card.ability:
Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor:
"You must shatter the fetters of the past. Only then can you truly act."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

card.name: Shriekgeist
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Shriekgeist deals combat damage to a player, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: Wounds of the flesh are easy to heal. Wounds of the mind may never be undone.

card.name: Sightless Ghoul
card.ability:
Sightless Ghoul can't block.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: It blindly marches on Thraben's gates, guided by its master's direful will.

card.name: Silverclaw Griffin
card.ability: Flying, first strike
card.flavor: It patrols the grafs for miles around Thraben, ensuring that the unhallowed do not wake for long.

card.name: Silverpelt Werewolf
card.ability:
Whenever Silverpelt Werewolf deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Silverpelt Werewolf.

card.name: Skillful Lunge
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Valor is a currency of the living that serves us well."
—Cosper Lowe of the Silbern Guard

card.name: Skirsdag Flayer
card.ability: {3}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Human: Destroy target creature.
card.flavor: Certain initiates into the Skirsdag cult take a vow of blindness, pledging obedience to none but demonkind.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : You can sacrifice any Human you control, including Skirsdag Flayer itself.
1/22/2011 : Because targets are chosen before costs are paid, you can activate Skirsdag Flayer's ability targeting itself and then sacrifice Skirsdag Flayer to pay the cost.

card.name: Somberwald Dryad
card.ability: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
card.flavor: The Somberwald is her domain, and she has yet to hear an acceptable excuse for trespassing.

card.name: Sorin, Lord of Innistrad
card.ability:
+1: Put a 1/1 black Vampire creature token with lifelink onto the battlefield.
-2: You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +1/+0."
-6: Destroy up to three target creatures and/or other planeswalkers. Return each card put into a graveyard this way to the battlefield under your control.
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The emblems are cumulative. If you get two of them, creatures you control will get +2/+0.
1/22/2011 : You can target a token creature with Sorin, Lord of Innistrad's third ability, but it won't return to the battlefield.
1/22/2011 : If a creature with undying is destroyed by Sorin, Lord of Innistrad's third ability, the undying ability will trigger, but the creature will already have been returned to the battlefield by Sorin. The undying ability won't do anything when it resolves.
1/22/2011 : If Sorin, Lord of Innistrad somehow becomes a creature, it can be chosen as a target of its own third ability. If Sorin, Lord of Innistrad is still on the battlefield when that ability resolves, it will then destroy Sorin and return him to the battlefield under your control.

card.name: Soul Seizer
card.ability:
Flying
When Soul Seizer deals combat damage to a player, you may transform it. If you do, attach it to target creature that player controls.

card.name: Spiteful Shadows
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to its controller.
card.flavor:
"Let us remind these human cattle why they fear the shadows of this world."
—Aldreg, Skirsdag cultist
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Spiteful Shadows causes the enchanted creature to deal damage to its controller. Abilities like lifelink and infect will apply.

card.name: Stormbound Geist
card.ability:
Flying
Stormbound Geist can block only creatures with flying.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Strangleroot Geist
card.ability:
Haste
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: Geists of the hanged often haunt the tree on which they died.

card.name: Stromkirk Captain
card.ability:
First strike
Other Vampire creatures you control get +1/+1 and have first strike.
card.flavor:
"No longer can we allow our human populations to be mindlessly slaughtered by ghouls. Slay all who trespass."
—Runo Stromkirk
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : If a creature with first strike deals damage in the first combat damage step, but then loses first strike before regular combat damage, it won't deal combat damage a second time (unless it also has double strike).

card.name: Sudden Disappearance
card.ability: Exile all nonland permanents target player controls. Return the exiled cards to the battlefield under their owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : If Sudden Disappearance's delayed triggered ability is countered or otherwise removed from the stack after triggering, the exiled cards will remain in exile indefinitely. The delayed triggered ability will only trigger once.

card.name: Talons of Falkenrath
card.ability:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{1}{R}: This creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn."

card.name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
card.ability:
First strike
Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
card.flavor: "Thraben is our home and I will not see it fall to this unhallowed horde."
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : The ability affects each spell that's not a creature spell, including your own.
1/22/2011 : The ability affects the total cost of each noncreature spell, but it doesn't change that spell's mana cost or converted mana cost.
1/22/2011 : When determining a spell's total cost, effects that increase the cost are applied before effects that reduce the cost.

card.name: Thought Scour
card.ability:
Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"As you inject the viscus vitae into the brain stem, don't let the spastic moaning bother you. It will soon become music to your ears."
—Stitcher Geralf
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : If the target player is an illegal target when Thought Scour tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card.
1/22/2011 : Follow the instructions in the order listed on the card: if you target yourself, you'll put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard and then draw a card.

card.name: Thraben Doomsayer
card.ability:
{T}: Put a 1/1 white Human creature token onto the battlefield.
Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control get +2/+2.
card.flavor: "Swarms of the unhallowed claw at Thraben's gates! Do you still deny the end approaches?"
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : A creature whose toughness is being increased by Thraben Doomsayer's fateful hour ability loses that bonus as soon as its controller has 6 or more life (or as soon as Thraben Doomsayer leaves the battlefield). If damage marked on that creature is greater than or equal to its toughness after the fateful hour ability stops applying, the creature is destroyed and put into its owner's graveyard.
1/22/2011 : If Thraben Doomsayer's activated ability resolves while you have 5 or less life, the creature token will be 3/3 as it enters the battlefield.

card.name: Thraben Heretic
card.ability: {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard.
card.flavor: "Let them decry me for burning the dead. I'm not giving those ghoulcallers any more fuel for their madness."

card.name: Torch Fiend
card.ability: {R}, Sacrifice Torch Fiend: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: Devils redecorate every room with fire.

card.name: Tovolar's Magehunter
card.ability:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Tovolar's Magehunter deals 2 damage to that player.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Tovolar's Magehunter.

card.name: Tower Geist
card.ability:
Flying
When Tower Geist enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Jenrik's tower is served by those who once sought to enter it uninvited.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : If there's only one card in your library when Tower Geist enters the battlefield, you'll look at that card and put it into your hand.

card.name: Tracker's Instincts
card.ability:
Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put a creature card from among them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : You must put a creature card from among the revealed cards into your hand if one is there, even if you'd rather put all the revealed cards into your graveyard.

card.name: Tragic Slip
card.ability:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Morbid — That creature gets -13/-13 until end of turn instead if a creature died this turn.
card.flavor: Linger on death's door and risk being invited in.

card.name: Ulvenwald Bear
card.ability: Morbid — When Ulvenwald Bear enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.
card.flavor:
Out chasing bears
—Kessig expression meaning "died in the woods"

card.name: Undying Evil
card.ability: Target creature gains undying until end of turn. (When it dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor:
"Is it true the evil that people do follows them into death? Let's find out."
—Liliana Vess

card.name: Unhallowed Cathar
card.ability: Unhallowed Cathar can't block.

card.name: Vault of the Archangel
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{W}{B}, {T}: Creatures you control gain deathtouch and lifelink until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"For centuries my creation kept this world in balance. Now only her shadow remains."
—Sorin Markov
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Vault of the Archangel's last ability affects only creatures you control when that ability resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.
1/22/2011 : Multiple instances of deathtouch or lifelink on the same creature are redundant.

card.name: Vengeful Vampire
card.ability:
Flying
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: He wields the full power of wrath unfettered by the sympathies of a soul.

card.name: Village Survivors
card.ability:
Vigilance
Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control have vigilance.
card.flavor: As their villages fell to werewolves, fleeing refugees discovered they too had remarkable survival instincts.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Tapping creatures to attack with them happens just before any required costs to attack with those creatures are paid. If paying such a cost causes your life total to fall below 6, your tapped attackers will have vigilance, but the ability will have no benefit that combat.

card.name: Vorapede
card.ability:
Vigilance, trample
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor:
"If you think you've killed one, guess again."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

card.name: Wakedancer
card.ability: Morbid — When Wakedancer enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Hers is an ancient form of necromancy, steeped in shamanic trance and ritual that few skaberen or ghoulcallers comprehend.

card.name: Warden of the Wall
card.ability:
Warden of the Wall enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
As long as it's not your turn, Warden of the Wall is a 2/3 Gargoyle artifact creature with flying.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Warden of the Wall still has the ability to tap for mana when it's not your turn.

card.name: Werewolf Ransacker
card.ability:
Whenever this creature transforms into Werewolf Ransacker, you may destroy target artifact. If that artifact is put into a graveyard this way, Werewolf Ransacker deals 3 damage to that artifact's controller.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Werewolf Ransacker.

card.name: Wild Hunger
card.ability:
Target creature gets +3/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Otto the Hunter was filled with many grand ambitions. The snake was filled only with Otto.

card.name: Withengar Unbound
card.ability:
Flying, intimidate, trample
Whenever a player loses the game, put thirteen +1/+1 counters on Withengar Unbound.

card.name: Wolfbitten Captive
card.ability:
{1}{G}: Wolfbitten Captive gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Wolfbitten Captive.

card.name: Wolfhunter's Quiver
card.ability:
Equipped creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player" and "{T}: This creature deals 3 damage to target Werewolf creature."
Equip {5}
card.flavor:
"Steel in the heart, silver in the bow."
—Wolfhunter's creed
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : Only the equipped creature's controller can activate the abilities it gains from Wolfhunter's Quiver.
1/22/2011 : For each of the activated abilities, the equipped creature is the source of the ability and the damage. For example, if the equipped creature is not an artifact, you could activate either ability targeting a creature with protection from artifacts.
1/22/2011 : You could activate the first ability targeting a Werewolf creature if you wanted to.

card.name: Wrack with Madness
card.ability: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
card.flavor: The skathul, spirits consumed by revenge, fester and seethe while looking for weak minds to assault.
card.ruling: 1/22/2011 : Creature abilities like deathtouch or lifelink may affect the results of the damage dealt.

card.name: Young Wolf
card.ability: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: The Ulvenwald makes no allowances for youth. Today's newborn is either tomorrow's hunter or tomorrow's lunch.

card.name: Zombie Apocalypse
card.ability: Return all Zombie creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped, then destroy all Humans.
card.flavor:
"There will come a day so dark you will pray for death. On that day your prayers will be answered."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum
card.ruling:
1/22/2011 : All Humans are destroyed, not just ones you control.
1/22/2011 : If a creature card in your graveyard is both a Zombie and a Human, it will be returned to the battlefield tapped, then be destroyed.
